Articles.Content:
Did a mission to Mun, and on return parked the craft in a low Kerbin orbit.  I exited out to the Space Centre so that I could fast warp to the next morning, with a view to returning to the craft and de-orbiting and landing near KSC in daylight.  Unfortunately on going to the tracking station, I can't select the craft and switch to it in order to bring it down.  In fact I can't do anything with any of the 4 flights currently in progress from the tracking station.  I've tried logging out of KSP and back in to see if that would solve the problem but it hasn't.

Only thing I can think of now is to send up an unmanned craft to a close rendezvous and see if I can switch in map mode, or use the [ ] to switch craft when I get close enough.

 

ETA: Switching craft from map view was successful, though the crew pictures in the bottom right of the screen only shows 2 flight crew.  Clicking on the crew hatch brings up 3 names, as it should be, so it appears there is a bug in there somewhere.

Edited April 19, 2016 by Scarecrow
